channel.title: Comments on: I Need to Make a Sight-Seeing Alt

item.title: By: Foton
item.dc:creator: Foton
item.description:
Some of my guild saw a sandstorm in Tanaris on the way to Silithus. I was envious. We tried to arrive in time to witness this phenom. Alas and alack.
Also, we didn't get any Essence of Air. Double ouch.
item.content:encoded:
Some of my guild saw a sandstorm in Tanaris on the way to Silithus. I was envious. We tried to arrive in time to witness this phenom. Alas and alack.

Also, we didn’t get any Essence of Air. Double ouch.

item.title: By: Derelict (Silver Hand, Horde)
item.dc:creator: Derelict (Silver Hand, Horde)
item.description:
I hear your pain :)
I saw some weather in Feralas, on the way to plinking around in Dire Maul last night.
Essentially ... meh. I didn't like weather effects in EQ, and the rain in Feralas wasn't anything special.
D
item.content:encoded:
I hear your pain ðŸ™‚

I saw some weather in Feralas, on the way to plinking around in Dire Maul last night.

Essentially … meh. I didn’t like weather effects in EQ, and the rain in Feralas wasn’t anything special.

D

item.title: By: uruloki
item.dc:creator: uruloki
item.description: Apparently, Tirisfal Glades is Seattle. Been doing the SM overpower run for silk lately, and the place is always raining. I am so glad that I always take my UD characters to Durotar to level.
item.content:encoded: Apparently, Tirisfal Glades is Seattle. Been doing the SM overpower run for silk lately, and the place is always raining. I am so glad that I always take my UD characters to Durotar to level.

item.title: By: Hyd
item.dc:creator: Hyd
item.description: I have yet to see any weather in Tanaris or STV, above and beyond the usual 'Partly cloudy with, 50% chance of getting ganked.'
item.content:encoded: I have yet to see any weather in Tanaris or STV, above and beyond the usual ‘Partly cloudy with, 50% chance of getting ganked.’

item.title: By: Pharkas
item.dc:creator: Pharkas
item.description: Is it that healers burn out or bore out?
item.content:encoded: Is it that healers burn out or bore out?

item.title: By: Byron Ellacott
item.dc:creator: Byron Ellacott
item.description:
It's not just raiding guilds that are geographically isolated. A level 60 has no interest in Elwynn, Tirisfal, Dun Morogh, Darkshore, Alterac, STV, Tanaris or Feralas, save when a travel path takes them through those places. High level gatherskillers may have an interest in Un'goro and Winterspring, but for other 60s, there's still not much reason to visit those zones.
Because one level in WoW represents such a large increase in power (well, it's more sort of at the two-level mark, but let's pretend otherwise) zones are tuned for a very small range of levels. If you're outside of that range, that zone is not interesting to you. At level 60, all non-instance zones become uninteresting, because there's not a great deal of content other than dungeon crawling.
Even if every outdoor zone got weather, you'd STILL never see it, because let's face it, we only leave the major cities to get into an instance. And maybe to farm.
item.content:encoded:
It’s not just raiding guilds that are geographically isolated. A level 60 has no interest in Elwynn, Tirisfal, Dun Morogh, Darkshore, Alterac, STV, Tanaris or Feralas, save when a travel path takes them through those places. High level gatherskillers may have an interest in Un’goro and Winterspring, but for other 60s, there’s still not much reason to visit those zones.

Because one level in WoW represents such a large increase in power (well, it’s more sort of at the two-level mark, but let’s pretend otherwise) zones are tuned for a very small range of levels. If you’re outside of that range, that zone is not interesting to you. At level 60, all non-instance zones become uninteresting, because there’s not a great deal of content other than dungeon crawling.

Even if every outdoor zone got weather, you’d STILL never see it, because let’s face it, we only leave the major cities to get into an instance. And maybe to farm.
